intro: Rubus transvaliensis, commonly known as the Transvaal blackberry, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained conditions. Rubus transvaliensis is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
